cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression / Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles SE of Great Abaco Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the north-western Bahamas Friday, expected to brush the east-central Florida coast Saturday, cross the peninsula into the eastern Gulf Sunday, then curve northward toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or just offshore the east-central Florida coast near or just north of West Palm Beach

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the north-western Bahamas (Abacos, Berry Islands, Bimini, Eleuthera, Grand Bahama Island, New Providence)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coast of south-central Florida from West Palm Beach northward to around Daytona Beach likely to experience tropical-storm conditions
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Friday night through Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft at high tide possible along the immediate coast and inlets
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized amounts up to 6–7 inches, beginning Friday and peaking Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Palm Beach County beaches
